byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil, and Mariana Simões from Rio de Janeiro.

abstract: Brazil's new Pres Michel Terner has promised new era of 'national salvation,' but his powerful party has history of problems in its management of state of Rio de Janeiro, including accusations of mismanagement of Summer Olympics; city of Rio de Janeiro is engulfed in crime wave, and state itself is in financial chaos.

headline.print_headline: Party Pledging Brazil Salvation Made Rio Crisis
headline.main: Entrusted to Save Brazil: The Party That Ruined Rio

snippet: The country’s new governing party has long wielded great power in this oil-rich state — a place afflicted by crime, graft, pollution and economic woes.
